long_desc.thetext:
Using Eclipse SDK Version: 4.4.0 Build id: I20130829-2000
I'm not sure exactly what code triggers the NPE but it seems it's when I hover on certain methods that override other methods. I'll try to isolate the code.
java.lang.NullPointerException at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.compiler.ast.QualifiedAllocationExpression.resolveType(QualifiedAllocationExpression.java:274) at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.compiler.ast.Expression.resolve(Expression.java:970) at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.compiler.ast.AbstractMethodDeclaration.resolveStatements(AbstractMethodDeclaration.java:510) at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.compiler.ast.MethodDeclaration.resolveStatements(MethodDeclaration.java:265) at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.compiler.ast.AbstractMethodDeclaration.resolve(AbstractMethodDeclaration.java:469) at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.compiler.ast.TypeDeclaration.resolve(TypeDeclaration.java:1185) at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.compiler.ast.TypeDeclaration.resolve(TypeDeclaration.java:1295) at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.compiler.ast.CompilationUnitDeclaration.resolve(CompilationUnitDeclaration.java:561) at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.core.hierarchy.HierarchyResolver.resolve(HierarchyResolver.java:789) at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.core.hierarchy.HierarchyResolver.resolve(HierarchyResolver.java:592) at at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.core.hierarchy.TypeHierarchy.refresh(TypeHierarchy.java:1267) at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.core.CreateTypeHierarchyOperation.executeOperation(CreateTypeHierarchyOperation.java:90) at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.core.JavaModelOperation.run(JavaModelOperation.java:728) at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.core.JavaModelOperation.runOperation(JavaModelOperation.java:788) at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.core.SourceType.newSupertypeHierarchy(SourceType.java:739) at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.core.SourceType.newSupertypeHierarchy(SourceType.java:691) at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.corext.util.SuperTypeHierarchyCache.getTypeHierarchy(SuperTypeHierarchyCache.java:144) at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.corext.util.SuperTypeHierarchyCache.getTypeHierarchy(SuperTypeHierarchyCache.java:96) at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.ui.text.javadoc.JavadocContentAccess2$JavadocLookup.getTypeHierarchy(JavadocContentAccess2.java:432) at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.ui.text.javadoc.JavadocContentAccess2$JavadocLookup.getInheritedDescription(JavadocContentAccess2.java:386) at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.ui.text.javadoc.JavadocContentAccess2$JavadocLookup.getInheritedMainDescription(JavadocContentAccess2.java:302) at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.ui.text.javadoc.JavadocContentAccess2.toHTML(JavadocContentAccess2.java:831) at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.ui.text.javadoc.JavadocContentAccess2.javadoc2HTML(JavadocContentAccess2.java:682) at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.ui.text.javadoc.JavadocContentAccess2.getHTMLContentFromSource(JavadocContentAccess2.java:604) at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.ui.text.javadoc.JavadocContentAccess2.getHTMLContent(JavadocContentAccess2.java:495) at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.ui.text.java.hover.JavadocHover.getHoverInfo(JavadocHover.java:694) at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.ui.text.java.hover.JavadocHover.internalGetHoverInfo(JavadocHover.java:612) at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.ui.text.java.hover.JavadocHover.getHoverInfo2(JavadocHover.java:604) at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.ui.text.java.hover.BestMatchHover.getHoverInfo2(BestMatchHover.java:163) at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.ui.text.java.hover.BestMatchHover.getHoverInfo2(BestMatchHover.java:129) at org.eclipse.jface.text.TextViewerHoverManager$4.run(TextViewerHoverManager.java:166)

Created attachment 235049 Sample project
I have isolated the code in a separate project. I seems it depends on some JDT or PDE preferences because the exception didn't occur until I copied over the preferences from the originating project.
In TmfCheckpointIndexer, hover on buildIndex. NPE occurs.

Stephan, please take a look.
if (compilerOptions.isAnnotationBasedNullAnalysisEnabled && (this.binding.tagBits & TagBits.IsNullnessKnown) == 0) {
this.binding is null.
Works fine on BETA_JAVA8, seems to have been fixed by Bug 415850 there.

I can reproduce this with this code:
http://git.eclipse.org/c/platform/eclipse.platform.swt.git/plain/examples/org.eclipse.swt.snippets/src/org/eclipse/swt/snippets/Snippet321.java
And this build: I20130902-2000
Stephan? It would be nice to have this fixed for M2. Would it help if I pushed a patch to gerrit combining the fixes from Bug 415850?
The NPE also occurs in 4.3.1 RC4 (M20130911-1000)

Sorry for not attending to this earlier. Given that we already have a simple fix in BETA_JAVA8 I plan to resolve this for 4.4 M2 and then propose for inclusion in 4.3.2 (sorry I missed 4.3.1 for this). The only "real work" will be distilling the sample program into a JUnit.
Stephan, do you still intend to push this for M2?

(In reply to Jayaprakash Arthanareeswaran from comment #7) > Stephan, do you still intend to push this for M2?
If I may, my plan as noted yesterday still holds. What would be the deadline for this? Today? Tomorrow?

(In reply to Stephan Herrmann from comment #8) > If I may, my plan as noted yesterday still holds. > What would be the deadline for this? > Today? Tomorrow?
Earlier would be better, not latter than tomorrow, perhaps? We have the stabilization builds early this week and won't be a bad idea to catch one of those.
This is a regression that got introduced after 4.4 M1, hence needs to be fixed for M2.

The fix as present already in BETA_JAVA8 also resolves this bug. I've express tested the patch and released for inclusion in the scheduled 8:00 am M2 build.
It's in commit 41a151c15f2313eec4e0f32689b6c8dd6f33167a

The NPE no longer occurs with the code given in comment #3.
Verified for 4.4 M2 with build I20130917-2000.
Stephan, unless I'm mistaken, the fix is not in the 4.3 branch yet. Could the same fix be applied?

(In reply to Marc-Andre Laperle from comment #14) > Stephan, unless I'm mistaken, the fix is not in the 4.3 branch yet. Could > the same fix be applied?
There's no need for that since

(In reply to Dani Megert from comment #15) > (In reply to Marc-Andre Laperle from comment #14) > > Stephan, unless I'm mistaken, the fix is not in the 4.3 branch yet. Could > > the same fix be applied? > > There's no need for that since
Please ignore that comment.

(In reply to Marc-Andre Laperle from comment #14) > Stephan, unless I'm mistaken, the fix is not in the 4.3 branch yet. Could > the same fix be applied?
Yes:
(In reply to Stephan Herrmann from comment #6) > ... I plan to resolve this for 4.4 M2 and then propose for > inclusion in 4.3.2 (sorry I missed 4.3.1 for this).
See also the target milestone 4.3.2
Please make sure this gets into this week M-build. Thanks.

(In reply to Dani Megert from comment #18) > Please make sure this gets into this week M-build. Thanks.
oops, are we approaching SR2 already?

(In reply to Stephan Herrmann from comment #19) > (In reply to Dani Megert from comment #18) > > Please make sure this gets into this week M-build. Thanks. > > oops, are we approaching SR2 already?
SR2 is early next year, but let us get this in asap, this is a safe fix and there is no reason to wait.
*** Bug 418827 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
*** Bug 418843 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

The simple fix from master cleanly applies in R4_3_maintenance. I've added also one more test from duplicate bug 418843.
I read comment 18 and comment 20 as the required +1 for backporting, running all tests and will release when green.
Released for 4.3.2 via http://git.eclipse.org/c/jdt/eclipse.jdt.core.git/commit/?h=R4_3_maintenance&id=39b64f412ebb05fcab9e4c92294ffc1b5633130a
*** Bug 419121 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
*** Bug 419578 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

Thanks for fixing bug 416267. I hit the bug about every 2-5 minutes throughout the day. It is really getting annoying.
I am running 4.3.1. I noticed that the bug has been fixed in 4.3.2. Version 4.3.2 wont ship until February 28, 2014. That is a long time to wait for something bothering me so frequently. Could this fix be pushed out sooner? Could a patch be uploaded to this bug?

(In reply to Nathan Reynolds from comment #27) > That is a long time to > wait for something bothering me so frequently. Could this fix be pushed out > sooner? Could a patch be uploaded to this bug?
I second this.

I'm sorry about the annoyance caused by this bug.
If you want to update before 4.3.2 ships that would be from http://download.eclipse.org/eclipse/updates/4.3-M-builds
See also http://wiki.eclipse.org/Eclipse_Project_Update_Sites
*** Bug 418273 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

I successfully patched Eclipse in a rather crude way.
I took the java code from http://git.eclipse.org/c/jdt/eclipse.jdt.core.git/tree/org.eclipse.jdt.core/compiler/org/eclipse/jdt/internal/compiler/ast/QualifiedAllocationExpression.java?h=R4_3_maintenance
I then compiled it and had to figure out 1 jar to add to the javac classpath. I will attach the generated class file.
I then made a backup of ...Eclipse\plugins\org.eclipse.jdt.core_3.9.1.v20130905-0837.jar. Then, I deleted the old QualifiedAllocationExpression.class from the jar file and added the new one.
I restarted Eclipse and now I can't get the problem to reproduce. :)
Created attachment 236627 Class file generated from the fixed code

(In reply to Nathan Reynolds from comment #31) > I successfully patched Eclipse in a rather crude way. > > I took the java code from > http://git.eclipse.org/c/jdt/eclipse.jdt.core.git/tree/org.eclipse.jdt.core/ > compiler/org/eclipse/jdt/internal/compiler/ast/QualifiedAllocationExpression. > java?h=R4_3_maintenance > > I then compiled it and had to figure out 1 jar to add to the javac > classpath. I will attach the generated class file. > > I then made a backup of > ...Eclipse\plugins\org.eclipse.jdt.core_3.9.1.v20130905-0837.jar. Then, I > deleted the old QualifiedAllocationExpression.class from the jar file and > added the new one. > > I restarted Eclipse and now I can't get the problem to reproduce. :)
If - for whatever reason - you do not want to update your install via p2 update from the M-build/stream, then you better download the latest M-build, take the JDT Core JAR, patch the version number in the manifest file and rename the JAR to match the one in R4.3.1 and then replace it in your install.

I know, it does nothing to the matter of this bug, but I seem to be unable to find a newer JDT version in http://download.eclipse.org/releases/maintenance or http://download.eclipse.org/eclipse/updates/4.3-M-builds. There's only v1.9.1 which I already have installed.

(In reply to Robin Kupper from comment #34) > I know, it does nothing to the matter of this bug, but I seem to be unable > to find a newer JDT version in > http://download.eclipse.org/releases/maintenance or
If you read the URL you can say it says *releases*, so for sure it won't contain something newer than 4.3.1 ;-).
> http://download.eclipse.org/eclipse/updates/4.3-M-builds. There's only > v1.9.1 which I already have installed.
When I look at the p2 repo I see this: org.eclipse.jdt.core_3.9.1.v20131009-0742.jar which is clearly newer than 4.3.1. Yes, the bundle version was not updated (bug 419845).

(In reply to Dani Megert from comment #35) > When I look at the p2 repo I see this: > org.eclipse.jdt.core_3.9.1.v20131009-0742.jar > which is clearly newer than 4.3.1.
Ah found it. The problem was that "Eclipse Java Development Tools" doesn't show up when "Group items by category" is checked. Updated to v3.9.1.v20131016-0800 and the annoying error messages are gone.
Thanks :)

(In reply to Robin Kupper from comment #36) > (In reply to Dani Megert from comment #35) > > When I look at the p2 repo I see this: > > org.eclipse.jdt.core_3.9.1.v20131009-0742.jar > > which is clearly newer than 4.3.1. > > Ah found it. The problem was that "Eclipse Java Development Tools" doesn't > show up when "Group items by category" is checked.
Right, a real problem - please add your voice to bug 262009!

This problem also affected call hierarchy and Java search on my installation. I do not want to run unstable code, so I used a adaptation of Dani Megert from comment #33:
1. Download http://download.eclipse.org/eclipse/updates/4.3-M-builds/M20131016-0800/plugins/org.eclipse.jdt.core_3.9.1.v20131009-0742.jar 2. Extract org.eclipse.jdt.internal.compiler.ast.QualifiedAllocationExpression 3. Use tools like 7-zip to overwrite the file in the old jar (there's no need to unzip/re-zip).
*** Bug 419929 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
Given the large number of people who are affected by this bug, is there any chance for an early 4.3.2 release?
*** Bug 420131 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

(In reply to Sebastian Zarnekow from comment #40) > Given the large number of people who are affected by this bug, is there any > chance for an early 4.3.2 release?
Talked about this with Stephan, Srikant and Markus at EclipseCon. Looks like the only possible workaround is to point people to the update site and tell them how to install the latest 4.3 milestone. Don't think this is a compelling solution but...
We/I could blog about it and create a sticky post on the JDT forum for that at least?

(In reply to Marcel Bruch from comment #42) > (In reply to Sebastian Zarnekow from comment #40) > > Given the large number of people who are affected by this bug, is there any > > chance for an early 4.3.2 release? > > Talked about this with Stephan, Srikant and Markus at EclipseCon. Looks like > the only possible workaround is to point people to the update site and tell > them how to install the latest 4.3 milestone.
Small correction: "milestone" -> "M-build". These are not declared milestones but maintenance builds which only contain 4.3.1 plus approved backported bugfixes. Should be more stable than milestones, actually.
And to reveal the secret on howto: it seems you need to disable "Group items by category", then find and install "Eclipse Java Development Tools", right?

(In reply to Stephan Herrmann from comment #43) > And to reveal the secret on howto: it seems you need to disable "Group items > by category", then find and install "Eclipse Java Development Tools", right?
Right. That's were many people will stumble over (I did first). Should be made clear.
As a side note, I wonder why this is not in any category to prevent this.

(In reply to Stephan Herrmann from comment #43) > (In reply to Marcel Bruch from comment #42) > > (In reply to Sebastian Zarnekow from comment #40) > > > Given the large number of people who are affected by this bug, is there any > > > chance for an early 4.3.2 release? > > > > Talked about this with Stephan, Srikant and Markus at EclipseCon. Looks like > > the only possible workaround is to point people to the update site and tell > > them how to install the latest 4.3 milestone. > > Small correction: "milestone" -> "M-build". > These are not declared milestones but maintenance builds which only contain > 4.3.1 plus approved backported bugfixes. Should be more stable than > milestones, actually. > > And to reveal the secret on howto: it seems you need to disable "Group items > by category", then find and install "Eclipse Java Development Tools", right?
(In reply to Marcel Bruch from comment #44) > (In reply to Stephan Herrmann from comment #43) > > And to reveal the secret on howto: it seems you need to disable "Group items > > by category", then find and install "Eclipse Java Development Tools", right? > > Right. That's were many people will stumble over (I did first). Should be > made clear. > > As a side note, I wonder why this is not in any category to prevent this.
Agree, it's a big mess:
http://download.eclipse.org/eclipse/updates/4.3 has no category. both http://download.eclipse.org/releases/kepler and http://download.eclipse.org/releases/kepler/201306260900 has it under "Programming Languages", called "Eclipse Java Development Tools" and http://download.eclipse.org/technology/epp/packages/kepler/ don't have it, which kind of makes sense, because it's full IDEs.

(In reply to Robert Papp from comment #45)
> Agree, it's a big mess: >
Which brings me back to the question: Is there a way to have an earlier 4.3.2? And if not, why is that not possible?

(In reply to Sebastian Zarnekow from comment #46) > Is there a way to have an earlier > 4.3.2? And if not, why is that not possible?
Do you want the release train update site to be updated? And/or all packages on eclipse.org/download?
In both cases all 70 projects must validate that they still work with each other. If a single project contributes any new piece the whole new validation process needs to be started for all projects. It will also hard to allow only JDT to do a single bug fix. Others will ask for a new SR1c, 1d, 1e and so on.
In a company setting, this would certainly be published. For Eclipse such a change is considered a high risk and thus will not happen until the next SR.
But different release models have been discussed elsewhere in great detail in the past weeks. I don't think this is a good place to do so (again).
Let's see if http://dev.eclipse.org/mhonarc/lists/platform-releng-dev/msg21753.html yields an answer :)

(In reply to Stephan Herrmann from comment #48) > Let's see if > http://dev.eclipse.org/mhonarc/lists/platform-releng-dev/msg21753.html > yields an answer :)
==> bug 420888.
